Translated into English by Robert Wittie, Master of Arts, Philiatr
monogr.author: Primerose, James

div.head: The Translators Preface to the Reader.
div.p:
HAving finished my Translation of the Popular errours, or the errours of the people in matter of Physicke, being a learned Treatise, lately set forth in Latine by Dr. PRIMEROSE the Physitian, my very good Friend, it pleased my aforesaid Author to write something touching the Antimoniall Cup, which is now adayes in such frequent use, and so much admired by some, and to give it to me to translate into into English, to be annexed to the former Treatise, being an Errour as common and grosse as any other; But seeing that the
Impression of the aforesaid Treatise a for some reasons procrastinated for a while, it was thought convenient at the request of some Friends, to substrast this from the other, and to set it forth in a small Pamphlet by it selfe, which • ow thou hast, being never till now in Print; The other wanting nothing but the Printers art, shall as soone as may be, be Pressed to doe thee service; meane while accept of this lovingly, expect the other patiently, as it is tendred willingly by him, who is thine in any friendly office.
